org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Petition of Sakutaro Kuwahara for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Copy of within notice received and service of came acknowledged this 27 day of January, 1920

The office of the undersigned, Suite 327 Colman Building, Seattle, Washington, is designated as the place at which service of all subsequent papers in this cause, except writs and process, may be made, and the undersigned hereby consents that service may be made at the said place of all subsequent papers, except writs and process.
In the Matter of the Petition of Sakutaro Kuwahara for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

To Henry M.White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Respondent, and to Hon. Robert C.Saunders, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, attorney for said Respondent:

TAKE NOTICE that Sakutaro Kuwahara, petitioner above-named, will on Saturday, the 31st day of January, 1920, at the hour of 11:00 o'clock A.M., before L.A.Michelson, a Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, at the office of the Eatonville Lumber Company, in the town of Eatonville, in the County of Pierce, and State of Washington, in said District, take the depositions of J.H.Galbraith and R.Ode; the said witnesses above named residing out of the County of King and more than twenty miles from Seattle the place of trial of the above entitled cause; said depositions will be taken upon oral interrogatories propounded to said witnesses at the time of taking said depositions.
